Client.summary: The Client interface represents an executable context such as a , or a . clients are represented by the more-specific . You can get Client/WindowClient objects from methods such as and .

ClientUrl.summary:
The url read-only property of the
interface returns the URL of the current service worker client.

ClientFrameType.summary: The frameType read-only property of the interface indicates the type of browsing context of the current . This value can be one of "auxiliary", "top-level", "nested", or "none".
ClientFrameType.value: One of these four strings: "auxiliary", "top-level", "nested", or "none".

ClientType.summary:
The type read-only property of the
interface indicates the type of client the service worker is controlling.
ClientType.value: A string, representing the client type. The value can be one of

ClientPostMessage.summary:
The postMessage() method of the
interface allows a service worker to send a message to a client
(a , , or ). The
message is received in the message event on
.

ClientId.summary: The id read-only property of the interface returns the universally unique identifier of the object.
ClientId.value: A string uniquely identifying the object.
